required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Duration of Continuous Positive Airway Pressure and Pulmonary Function Testing in Preterm Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Duration of Continuous Positive Airway Pressure and Pulmonary Function Testing in Preterm Infants

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to quantify and compare changes in lung volumes (as measured by functional residual capacity) in premature infants stable on continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP), and then randomized to two additional weeks of CPAP and room air versus room air alone. We hypothesize that infants randomized to additional CPAP will demonstrate an increased functional residual capacity (at the end of the two week study period and prior to discharge) compared to those randomized to room air.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in the Measurements of Functional Residual Capacity (FRC) in Randomized Premature Infants
primary_outcome.time_frame: Just prior to randomization, two weeks later and at discharge (an average of 34 to 37 weeks of corrected gestational age).
primary_outcome.description: Functional residual capacity (FRC) was measured with the nitrogen washout technique. For the nitrogen washout technique, calibration is done with 2 known volumes, and a calibration line was constructed for the system at the specific flow rate and used to correlate the nitrogen washed out to the infant's FRC. The system corrected for dead space and corrected the FRC to body temperature, pressure, and water-saturated conditions. Acceptance criteria included: 1) infant supine and quietly asleep; 2) test initiated at end expiration; 3) no evidence of leak on tracing of the washout; 4) consistent tracings; 5) at least 2-3 measurements with a coefficient of variation <10%. These are testing and acceptance criteria outlined by the American Thoracic Society and European Respiratory Society.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurements of Passive Respiratory Compliance in Randomized Premature Infants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Just before randomization, two weeks later, and at discharge at about 35-37 weeks of corrected gestational age
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements of passive respiratory compliance will be done with the single breath occlusion technique.

secondary_outcome.measure: Passive Respiratory Resistance in Randomized Premature Infants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Just prior to randomization, two weeks after randomization, and at discharge at about 35-37 weeks of corrected gestational age.
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements of passive respiratory resistance will be done with the single breath occlusion technique.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurements of Tidal Flow Volume Loops Will be Done in the Randomized Premature Infants.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Just before randomization, two weeks later, and at discharge at about 35-37 weeks of corrected gestational age.
secondary_outcome.description: Characteristics of tidal flow volume loops will be measured.

other_outcome.measure: Changes in the Growth Parameters Between the Randomized Premature Infants
other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization through discharge at about 35-37 weeks of corrected gestational age.
other_outcome.description: Changes in growth parameters will be compared between randomized groups.

other_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events in the Randomized Groups of Premature Infants.
other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization through discharge from the neonatal intensive care unit (an average of 35 to 37 weeks of corrected gestational age).
other_outcome.description: Adverse events and serious adverse events occurring in the randomized groups will be documented carefully

other_outcome.measure: Corrected Gestational Age at Which Full Nipple Feeds Are Achieved
other_outcome.time_frame: Randomization through discharge at about 35-37 weeks of corrected gestational age.
other_outcome.description: The corrected gestational age at which full nipple feeds are achieved will be compared between the randomized groups.

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of Wheezing Through One Year of Age
other_outcome.time_frame: Discharge through one year of corrected age
other_outcome.description: Incidence of wheezing will be compared through one year of corrected gestational age between the randomized groups.
Cost comparison through 12 months of corrected gestational age between the randomized groups per percent improvement in FRC measured at discharge between the groups.

other_outcome.measure: Days on Oxygen Between the Randomized Groups
other_outcome.time_frame: Through discharge at about 35-37 weeks of corrected gestational age
other_outcome.description: The days of oxygen supplementation will be compared between the groups of randomized patients.

other_outcome.time_frame: Delivery through discharge at about 35-37 weeks of corrected gestational age
other_outcome.description: The days in the hospital will be compared between the randomized groups.

arm_group.description: Stable premature infants on CPAP and room air will be randomized to stay on CPAP for an additional two weeks.
Premature stable infants on CPAP and room air will be randomized to transition to room air alone.

intervention.description: Stable premature infants on CPAP and room air and meeting specific stability criteria will be randomized to stay on continuous positive airway pressure and room air for an additional two weeks or will be transitioned to room air alone.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gestational age at birth <33 weeks
- Required CPAP for a minimum of 24 hours for respiratory distress
- Patient on CPAP and room air at time of randomization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Complex congenital heart disease other than patent ductus arteriosus or atrial septal defect
- Major malformations or chromosomal anomalies
- Multiple gestation greater than twins
- Culture proven sepsis or unstable at time of randomization

group.title: CPAP and Room Air
group.description: Stable premature infants on CPAP and room air will be randomized to stay on CPAP for an additional two weeks. CPAP and room air: Stable premature infants on CPAP and room air and meeting specific stability criteria will be randomized to stay on continuous positive airway pressure and room air for an additional two weeks or will be transitioned to room air alone.

group.title: Room Air
group.description: Premature stable infants on CPAP and room air will be randomized to transition to room air alone.

with technically acceptable pulmonary function tests in the neonatal intensive care unit

group.description: Premature stable infants on CPAP and room air will be randomized to transition to room air alone.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Changes in the Measurements of Functional Residual Capacity (FRC) in Randomized Premature Infants
outcome.description: Functional residual capacity (FRC) was measured with the nitrogen washout technique. For the nitrogen washout technique, calibration is done with 2 known volumes, and a calibration line was constructed for the system at the specific flow rate and used to correlate the nitrogen washed out to the infant's FRC. The system corrected for dead space and corrected the FRC to body temperature, pressure, and water-saturated conditions. Acceptance criteria included: 1) infant supine and quietly asleep; 2) test initiated at end expiration; 3) no evidence of leak on tracing of the washout; 4) consistent tracings; 5) at least 2-3 measurements with a coefficient of variation <10%. These are testing and acceptance criteria outlined by the American Thoracic Society and European Respiratory Society.
outcome.time_frame: Just prior to randomization, two weeks later and at discharge (an average of 34 to 37 weeks of corrected gestational age).

measure.title: Changes in the Measurements of Functional Residual Capacity (FRC) in Randomized Premature Infants
measure.description: Functional residual capacity (FRC) was measured with the nitrogen washout technique. For the nitrogen washout technique, calibration is done with 2 known volumes, and a calibration line was constructed for the system at the specific flow rate and used to correlate the nitrogen washed out to the infant's FRC. The system corrected for dead space and corrected the FRC to body temperature, pressure, and water-saturated conditions. Acceptance criteria included: 1) infant supine and quietly asleep; 2) test initiated at end expiration; 3) no evidence of leak on tracing of the washout; 4) consistent tracings; 5) at least 2-3 measurements with a coefficient of variation <10%. These are testing and acceptance criteria outlined by the American Thoracic Society and European Respiratory Society.

class.title: FRC change from baseline to two weeks
FRC change from baseline to discharge

analysis.groups_desc: FRC values over time were modeled using linear mixed effects regression with treatment group vs. time interaction and repeated measures for the randomization, 2 week, and discharge time points. Compound symmetric covariance structures were used to account for the correlation of FRC values within each patient. We compared outcomes between the two treatment groups and included adjustments for gender, twin gestation, and weight at randomization.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
